alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 12:25PM CST until February 16 at 12:45PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following counties, Carroll, Crockett, Dyer, Gibson, Haywood, Lauderdale, Madison, Obion, Tipton and Weakley. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1225 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 3 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brownsville, Humboldt, Ripley, Milan, Trenton, Alamo, Bells, Dyer, Halls, Rutherford, Bradford, Atwood, Eaton, Chestnut Bluff, Holly Grove, Belle Eagle, Forked Deer, Nutbush, Medina and Henning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
